      • SimpleCalculation

        public java.lang.Double SimpleCalculation​(Functions.SimpleCal newFunc,
                                          java.lang.Double num)
        The function calls SimpleCalculationImplementation to implement: normal, plus, minus, multiply, divide, xPowerY
        Parameters:
        newFunc - enum function name that user want to use
        num - the input number
        Returns:
        the result of SimpleCalculationImplementation

      • EqualCalculation

        public java.lang.Double EqualCalculation​(java.lang.Double num)
        The warp function for SimpleCalculation
        Parameters:
        num - the input number
        Returns:
        the result of SimpleCalculation

      • reset

        public java.lang.Double reset()
        The function to clean up all of the memory of calculator
        Returns:
        a empty memory for next calculation

      • ComplexCalculation

        public java.lang.Double ComplexCalculation​(Functions.ComplexCal newFunc,
                                           java.lang.Double num)
        This function is used then user clicked on response buttons: square, squareRoot, sin, cos, tan, sinh, cosh, tanh, ePower, std, piPower
        Parameters:
        newFunc - enum function name that user wants to use
        num - the number passed in
        Returns:
        the result after calculation

      • factorial

        public static double factorial​(double i)
        A simple recursive factorial function, to be used as a helper function.
        Parameters:
        i - The base.
        Returns:
        The factorial of the double i passed into the function.

      • power

        public static double power​(double x,
                           double y)
        A simple recursive power function for integers, to be used a helper function.
        Parameters:
        x - The base.
        y - The exponent.
        Returns:
        x to the power of y.

      • standardDeviation

        public java.lang.Double standardDeviation​(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> numbers)
        Returns the standard deviation of a data sample that is given to the function in the form of a list of doubles
        Parameters:
        numbers - list containing the sample data
        Returns:
        standard deviation of sample data

      • squareRoot

        public static double squareRoot​(double number)
        Returns the square root of a any given double. The input is simply the number on which the square root function will be performed This function is used as a helper function for calculation the standard deviation
        Parameters:
        number - double that will be square rooted
        Returns:
        the result of the square root

      • ePower

        public double ePower​(double x)
        This calculates the exponential function by integrating the power and factorial helper functions in an infinite expansion series. The series iterates 15 times, which gives it a decent precision.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of the power given to the function
        Returns:
        the sum of the infinite series

      • cos

        public static double cos​(double z)
        Cosine method. Calculates the cosine of a given number, in radians, with 17 decimal precision.
        Parameters:
        z - The double for which the cosine must be calculated.
        Returns:
        The cosine of z.

      • cosh

        public static double cosh​(double z)
        Cosh method. Calculates the cosh of a given number, in radians, with 17 decimal precision.
        Parameters:
        z - The double for which the cosh must be calculated.
        Returns:
        The cosh of z.

      • piCal

        public double piCal​(double input)
        π^x method. Calculates the π^x of a given number
        Parameters:
        input - is double for which the exponent of π must be calculated.
        Returns:
        The π^x of input.

      • checkDecOfInupt

        public int checkDecOfInupt​(double input)
        This function of use to convert decimal value to integer.
        Parameters:
        input - of input number
        Returns:
        value of integer (1 if input is 0.1, 12 if input is 0.12)

      • tenExpByPi

        public double tenExpByPi​(double input)
        This function of use to calculate the decimal exponent value.
        Parameters:
        input - of input number after decimal (0.1 if input is 3.1, 0.12 if input is 3.12)
        Returns:
        decimal exponent value (10 if input is 0.1, 100 if input is 0.12)

      • power_sqrt

        public double power_sqrt​(double ori,
                         int exp)
        This function of use to calculate the nth square root.
        Parameters:
        exp - for the exponent
        ori - for the base
        Returns:
        the calculated output of a nth square root
